channel.title: Musings - snippets of advice & inspiration from people in the web industry

item.title: Set Questions, Not Tasks
item.description: Instead of setting your staff tasks, give them questions to solve.
item.author: garethadavies

item.title: Self Belief
item.description: Always believe in your own ability. Use criticism to improve, not to get disheartened.
item.author: benhubbard434

item.title: Control
item.description: Control your information sources, aggressively. They have a colossal impact on your social and working lives.
item.author: oliverjash

item.title: On Originality
item.description: There are no original ideas. Only better ones.
item.author: _dte

item.title: Inspiration
item.description: Leave Dribbble for a while and get inspired by the things you’ve created yourself.
item.author: radlikewhoa_

item.title: Relax Dude
item.description: Relax Dude, don’t get hung up in the finer details of things. Don’t stress yourself over inability to do certain aspects. Just relax and take the challenges as they come.
item.author: ryanAmurphy

item.title: Pursue Passionate Projects
item.description: Create something you’re passionate about, chances are you’ll try harder.
item.author: de

item.title: Craft
item.description: Treat your code like any other composition, such as a poem, an essay, a public blog, or an important email. Craft what you express carefully, so that it does what it should and communicates as directly as possible what it is doing, so that it still communicates your intention when you are no longer around.
item.author: taylorlapeyre

item.title: Fresh Eyes
item.description: Take a step back from your work, remove yourself and re-evaluate your work without preconception. It is important to try and see your work for the first time, more than just that first time.
item.author: dandgough

item.title: Learning
item.description: Struggling to learn something? Take some time away from it; your subconscious is far more powerful than your conscious mind.
item.author: benhowdle

item.title: Development Confidence
item.description: Keep building, work on side projects to widen your ability and increase your self-confidence. Now when clients ask you if something can be done, you can be sure.
item.author: andrewhathaway

item.title: Humility FTW
item.description: Confidence is easy to fake, humility less so.
item.author: adamwhitcroft

item.title: Critique
item.description: Critique is not personal. Ask for it, accept it, think on it and only if appropriate, implement it. Disregarding it is perfectly acceptable.
item.author: michaelw90

item.title: Confidence
item.description: Be confident with your designs, stay committed to them. If you don’t, who will?
item.author: iamlouisbullock

item.title: Challenges
item.description: Challenge yourself continuously. Take on work that you’re not that comfortable doing, this helps apply learning in a real situation, with real consequences.
item.author: benhowdle
